column7: Lynas is the only significant producer of separated rare earths. Lynas'Lynas' rare earth products include Neodymium and Praseodymium (NdPr) used in magnets, Lanthanum (La), Cerium (Ce) and a Mixed Heavy Rare Earths compound (SEG).
Lynas Rare Earths Limited (Lynas) is headquartered in Perth, Western Australia.
Lynas Rare Earths Limited (Lynas) operates in Australia, Malaysia, and The United States of America.
Lynas Rare Earths Limited's (Lynas) largest shareholders are individual investors with 57% ownership. Institutions own 43%.
column24: Lynas Rare Earths Limited's (ASX:LYC) largest shareholders are individual investors with 57% ownership, institutions own 43% - Simply Wall St News

column7: The key markets for these materials are manufacturing supply chains in East Asia, Europe and North America.
Lynas Rare Earth Limited is a multinational company that operates in Australia, Malaysia, and the USA.

column6: Information on employees and other workers
column7: Lynas employed 1102 people across Malaysia and Australia. Our employees include geologists, engineers, metallurgists, tradespeople, process technicians and others in support functions across both operating sites (Mt Weld and Gebeng) as well as professional and administrative functions undertaken at our offices in Perth, Western Australia and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
Lynas is the only significant producer of separated rare earths outside of China.

column6: Significant changes to the organization and its supply chain
column7: Lynas also offers mine-to-motor traceability with selected downstream manufacturing partners.
Lynas aims to be the supplier of choice for our customers and a leader in sustainably produced rare earths. This vision lives through our people and the way we do business.

The Lynas Rare Earths (Lynas) Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) Report 2023 outlines the company's ongoing commitment to report progress towards the principles of the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC), ISO Standards 9001, 14001, 45001, Development of ISO TC 298, etc.

Lynas Rare Earths Limited (Lynas) is a member of the Malaysian Australian Business Council, the Minerals Council of Australia, The Chamber of Minerals and Energy of Western Australia, the Goldfields Aboriginal Business Chamber, etc.

"This has been an exciting year for Lynas with the completion of major construction works and commencement of stage 4 commissioning at our new Kalgoorlie Rare Earths Processing Facility. This new facility provides jobs and economic benefits to the Goldfields and Western Australian economies".

During the financial year ending 30 June 2022, the Group appointed Price Waterhouse Coopers to recommend an internal audit plan focused on critical areas of the business consistent with the outcomes of the risk mapping process.

column13: The Lynas materiality process complements our risk practices as we assess the critical external impacts of our activities and their related business consequences, including through reporting against the Task Force for Climate-related Financial Disclosures framework.

Lynas began implementing an internal audit function during the financial year ending 30 June 2022. The internal audit function has previously focussed on compliance with ISO standards by the Group's operating processes. It will be progressively expanded to other critical risk areas in the business.
